thread.title: 7 innovative ways to improve voting percentage in Mumbai
thread.title_full: 7 innovative ways to improve voting percentage in Mumbai

author: sagarcasm
title: 7 innovative ways to improve voting percentage in Mumbai
text:
7 innovative ways to improve voting percentage in Mumbai 22, Feb 2017 By sagarcasm 
Mumbai recorded 55.28 % voter turnout on Tuesday during the BMC civic polls. Although it is the highest voter turnout in 25 years for Mumbai, it is still very low when you compare it to other places. More people should come out to vote. Hence we bring you 7 innovative ways to improve voting percentage in Mumbai 7. No toll on the next ride on the Bandra-Worli sea link for all voters 6. If you vote, you get a free Rain Insurance for any damages done by rains during the next monsoon 5. Conduct voting in Goa 4. Conduct voting online so that people donâ€™t have to face traffic 3. Give VIP passes of Lalbaugcha Raja for Ganeshotsav to people who vote before 8 am 2. Free bus and train rides on the day of elections 1. Give a free Bhel puri or Vada Pav at polling booths after one castes his/her vote
